description: O2 Oxygen Sensor Circuit High Voltage (Bank1, Sensor1)
info: This diagnostic trouble code (DTC) is a generic powertrain code, which means that it applies to OBD-II equipped vehicles. Although generic, the specific repair steps may vary depending on make/model.
This involves the front oxygen sensor on Bank 1. This code indicates that the heated oxygen sensor reading is too high.
In the case of Ford vehicles, that indicates the voltage at the sensor is over 1.5 volts. Other vehicles may be similar.
symptoms: You will likely not notice any drivability problems.
causes: A code P0132 may mean that one or more of the following has happened:

The oxygen sensor heater circuit is shorted out
The wiring to the sensor is broken / frayed (less likely)
